data.question: What is the DOI for the International Edition of the article on Magnetic Sponges?
Which compound undergoes drastic charge-ordered state variations via three distinct states?
What are the three distinct states that the compound [{Ru2(m-FPhCO2)4}2TCNQ-(OMe)2]·nDCE can adopt?
data.answer: A two-electron-transferred state (2e-I), a charge-disproportionated state (1.5e-I), and a one-electron-transferred state (1e-I)

data.question: True or False: The stabilization of the 1e-I state of 1-DCE is due to the absence of host–guest hydrogen bonding.
What triggers the solvation-dependent magnetic switch in the system discussed?
True or False: The magnetic phase and critical temperatures (Tc) are not affected by the charge-ordered states of the compound.
What is the critical temperature (Tc) for the ferrimagnetic state in 1.5e-Id?
True or False: The compound 1-4DCE exhibits paramagnetic behavior in the 2e-I state.
What is the effect of resolvation of 1 on its magnetic states?
data.answer: It allows 1-DCE to switch between 1.5e-I and 1e-I states and to become ferrimagnetic.

data.question: True or False: The desolvation/solvation cycles between 1 and 1-DCE are irreversible.
What type of hydrogen bonding motif is found between the DCE molecule and the carboxylate-oxygen of the [Ru(2)2] unit?
True or False: The presence of DCE molecules has no effect on the stabilization of the 1e-I state in 1-nDCE.
What is the main reason for the stabilization of the 1e-I state in 1-reDCE according to DFT calculations?
True or False: The theoretical study suggests that the stabilization of the 1e-I state in 1-reDCE is similar to mechanisms found in biological systems.
What is the role of host–guest interactions in the control of the electronic state of the framework material?
data.answer: They are useful to control the electronic state of the framework material.

data.question: True or False: The article suggests that the modulation of the intrinsic spin state in a correlated lattice is an inefficient strategy for changing magnetism.
What is the DOI for the German Edition of the article on Magnetic Sponges?
What is the critical temperature (Tc) for the ferrimagnetic state in 1e-I?
What is the effect of the CH···O hydrogen bonding motif on the electronic state of the compound?
data.answer: It stabilizes the intermediate 1e-I state by tuning the electron-donating ability of the donor units.

data.question: True or False: The article provides evidence that molecular magnets lack flexibility in their structures and electronic/spin states.
